questions.question: ___________ protects the creator of an original work.

choices.answer: Fair use
Plagiarism
Copyright
Public domain

questions.question: What does the Fair Use Act do?

choices.answer: Allows copying of copyrighted material that is posted on the Internet
Allows limited copying of copyrighted works for educational purposes
Allows copying of copyrighted material that is printed in books or magazine
Specifies works not restricted by copyright and do not require a license
Copyrighted works that are posted on the Internet
Work not restricted by copyright and do not require a license or fee to use
Copyrighted works that are printed in publicly available books
Copyrighted works that can be copied on a limited basis for education

questions.question: When using someone elseâ€™s work, it is important to:

choices.answer: copy and paste all of the author's research used in preparing the work.
print a copy of any work you are using.
give the author credit by citing the work in your bibliography.
send the author money.

questions.question: Improve your Web search results by using:

choices.answer: advanced computers.
advanced search options.
various Web browsers.
various Internet Service Providers.
Obtaining permission from a copyright owner to use his or her work
Paying the author a fee to use his or her copyrighted works
Using copyrighted works without the copyright owner's permission
Citing copyrighted material in a bibliography

questions.question: Which is used to locate Web pages about certain topics and find specific pages that include videos, images, and maps?

choices.answer: Search engines
Web addresses
Web browsers
Internet services

questions.question: What is the only condition that a work must meet in order to be protected by copyright?

choices.answer: It must be an original expression.
It must be presented by a law office.
It must have the copyright symbol.
It must be printed and filed with an agency.

questions.question: Copyrighted material can be used if you:

choices.answer: include a reference to the author.
are using the material for a school assignment.
do not see a copyright symbol.
pay a fee, obtain permission or follow Fair Use guidelines.

questions.question: Boolean operators are used with ________ in a search engine to refine a search.

choices.answer: symbols
an image
keywords
a password
Lists of the books you used in your project.
Always written the same way.
Specific, in-text notices you use to show where you got your source
Only necessary if you're publishing something in print.

questions.question: Which of the following are protected by copyright? Choose all that apply.

choices.answer: Projects you create for school.
Music you record/upload to the Internet and videos you upload to YouTube
Books that are published and printed on paper.
Music that you download from the Internet.

questions.question: Which of these is a warning that you should treat a Web site's content with care?

choices.answer: It's a well-known research site.
The information is up-to-date with current data.
It cites its sources.
It seems to be supporting one opinion or theory over others (bias).

questions.question: Which of these acts violates copyright?

choices.answer: Buying music and letting your friend have a copy.
Lip-syncing with your favorite song and uploading the video to YouTube
Quoting someone else's work with citation.
Buying a song and downloading it to your laptop, and then copying it to SD

questions.question: Your teacher makes copies of an article from the newspaper and uses it in the classroom. What should you tell them?

choices.answer: "You're not allowed to copy someone's work. You're violating copyright."
"This falls under educational fair use, if you're only using it in class."
"You needed to purchase a newspaper for each student."
"You're violating copyright!"
